alert.note: Alert for Potter (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 10:36AM CDT until June 04 at 2:54AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Canadian River at Amarillo 19N affecting Potter County. For the Canadian River...including Amarillo 19N...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Canadian River at Amarillo 19N. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Portions of Rosita Creek Flats Recreational Area floods. Primitive campers and recreational vehicles are in imminent danger. Dirt roads that lead to highway 287 from Rosita Creek Flats are impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Friday the stage was 6.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 9.5 feet just after midnight tonight. By Monday morning the river is expected to be at 5.3 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 06/24/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM CDT.
